    • Method Detail

      • changeMedia

        public javax.ws.rs.core.Response changeMedia(java.lang.String sessionId,
                                             java.lang.String objectId,
                                             java.lang.String driveId,
                                             java.lang.String label)
        Changes digital object's medium in an emulation session. Since a digital object can be composed of multiple media, a medium's name must also be specified.
        Parameters:
        sessionId - The session's ID.
        driveId - The drive's ID for changing medium.
        objectId - The ID of a digital object.
        label - The name of a new medium.
        Returns:
        A JSON response containing the result message.

      • characterizeObject

        public javax.ws.rs.core.Response characterizeObject(java.lang.String objectId)
        Characterizes the specified digital object and returns a list of supported environments. When the characterization is successful, a JSON response will be returned, containing: 
         {
      "status": "0",
      "environments": [
          { "id": <Environment's ID>, "label": "Environment's label" },
          ...
      ]
 }
        When the specified object is not found or an internal error occurs, a JSON response containing the corresponding message will be returned: 
         {
      "status": "1",
      "message": "Error message."
 }
        Parameters:
        objectId - The object's ID to look up environments for.
        Returns:
        A JSON object with supported environments when found, else an error message.

      • configureEnv

        public javax.ws.rs.core.Response configureEnv(java.lang.String envId)
        Creates and configures a new session using specified environment. When the session is successfully created, a JSON response will be returned, containing: 
         {
      "status": "0",
      "id": <Session's ID>,
      "iframeurl": <IFrame's URL>
 }
        When an internal error occurs, a JSON response containing the corresponding message will be returned: 
         {
      "status": "1",
      "message": "Error message."
 }
        Parameters:
        envId - The environment's ID to use for session.
        Returns:
        A JSON object describing the created session, else an error message.

      • getDigitalObjectMediaDescription

        public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getDigitalObjectMediaDescription(java.lang.String objectId)
        Returns a description of media corresponding to a specified digital object: 
         {
      "status": "0",
      "media": [
          {
              "mediumtype": <Medium's type>,
              "labels": [ "label-1", ..., "label-n" ]
          },
          ...
      ]
 }
        Parameters:
        objectId - The digital object's ID.
        Returns:
        A JSON response containing media description, or an error message.

      • getEmilEnvironments

        public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getEmilEnvironments()
        Looks up and returns a list of all Emil's environments as a JSON object: 
         {
      "status": "0",
      "environments": [
          {
              "envId": <Environment's ID>,
              "os": "Environment's OS name",
              "title": "Environment's title",
              "description": "Environment's description",
              "version": "Environment's version",
              "emulator": "Environment's emulator"
          },
          ...
      ]
 }
        Returns:
        A JSON object containing the environment descriptions.

      • getObjectEnvironments

        public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getObjectEnvironments(java.lang.String objectId)
        Looks up and returns environments for specified object. When the specified object is found, a JSON response will be returned, containing: 
         {
      "status": "0",
      "environments": [
          { "id": <Environment's ID>, "label": "Environment's label" },
          ...
      ]
 }
        When the specified object is not found or an internal error occurs, a JSON response containing the corresponding message will be returned: 
         {
      "status": "1",
      "message": "Error message."
 }
        Parameters:
        objectId - The object's ID to look up environments for.
        Returns:
        A JSON object with supported environments when found, else an error message.

      • getObjectList

        public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getObjectList()
        Looks up and returns a list of all digital objects as a JSON object: 
         {
      "status": "0",
      "objects": [
          {
              "id": <Object's ID>,
              "title": "Object's title",
              "description": "Object's description",
              "thumbnail": "Optional thumbnail URL"
          },
          ...
      ]
 }
        Returns:
        A JSON object containing the list of all digital objects.

      • getObjectMetadata

        public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getObjectMetadata(java.lang.String objectId)
        Looks up and returns metadata for specified object.
        Parameters:
        objectId - The object's ID to look up metadata for.
        Returns:
        A JSON object with object's metadata when found, else an error message.

      • getSoftwarePackageDescription

        public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getSoftwarePackageDescription(java.lang.String softwareId)
        Looks up and returns the description for a specified software package. When the software package is found, a JSON response will be returned, containing: 
         {
      "status": "0",
      "id": <SoftwarePackage's ID>,
      "label": "Short description"
 }
        When an internal error occurs, a JSON response containing the corresponding message will be returned: 
         {
      "status": "1",
      "message": "Error message."
 }
        Parameters:
        softwareId - The software package's ID to look up.
        Returns:
        A JSON response containing software package's description when found, else an error message.

      • getSoftwarePackageDescriptions

        public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getSoftwarePackageDescriptions()
        Looks up and returns the descriptions for all software packages. A JSON response will be returned, containing: 
         {
      "status": "0",
      "descriptions": [
          { "id": <SoftwarePackage's ID>, "label": "Short description" },
          ...
      ]
 }
        When an internal error occurs, a JSON response containing the corresponding message will be returned: 
         {
      "status": "2",
      "message": "Error message."
 }
        Returns:
        A JSON response containing a list of descriptions for all software packages or an error message.

      • overrideObjectCharacterization

        public javax.ws.rs.core.Response overrideObjectCharacterization(de.bwl.bwfla.emil.datatypes.OverrideCharacterizationRequest request)

      • reboot

        public javax.ws.rs.core.Response reboot(java.lang.String sessionId)

      • saveEnvConfigration

        public javax.ws.rs.core.Response saveEnvConfigration(de.bwl.bwfla.emil.datatypes.EnvironmentConfigurationDesc desc)
        Stops the specified session and saves it's configuration as a new Emil environment. This method expects a JSON object containing: 
         {
      "sessionId": <Session's ID>,
      "envId": <Environment's ID>,
      "message": "Configuration description"
 }
        When an internal error occurs, a JSON response containing the corresponding message will be returned: 
         {
      "status": "1",
      "message": "Error message."
 }
        Parameters:
        desc - The description of a new environment.
        Returns:
        A JSON object containing the result message.

      • saveNewEnvironment

        public javax.ws.rs.core.Response saveNewEnvironment(de.bwl.bwfla.emil.datatypes.NewEnvironmentDesc desc)
        Stops the specified session and saves it's configuration as a new Emil environment. This method expects a JSON object containing a description of the new environment: 
         {
      "sessionId": <Session's ID>,
      "envId": <ID of the current environment>,
      "softwareId": <SoftwarePackage's ID>,
      "title": "New title",
      "description": "New description"
 }
        If a new environment is saved successfully, a JSON object will be returned containing: 
         {
      "status": "0",
      "envId": <ID of the new environment>,
      "message": "Info message.",
 }
        When an internal error occurs, a JSON object containing the corresponding message will be returned: 
         {
      "status": "1",
      "message": "Error message."
 }
        Parameters:
        desc - The description of a new environment.
        Returns:
        A JSON object containing the result or an error message.

      • screenshot

        public javax.ws.rs.core.Response screenshot(java.lang.String sessionId)
        Takes and returns a screenshot of the running emulation session.
        Parameters:
        sessionId - The session ID to take the screenshot of.
        Returns:
        A HTML response containing the PNG encoded screenshot.

      • startEnvWithDigitalObject

        public javax.ws.rs.core.Response startEnvWithDigitalObject(java.lang.String envId,
                                                           java.lang.String objectId)
        Creates and configures a new session using specified environment and digital object. When the session is successfully created, a JSON response will be returned, containing: 
         {
      "status": "0",
      "id": <Session's ID>,
      "driveId": <Drive's ID containing the digital object>,
      "iframeurl": <IFrame's URL>,
      "helpmsg": "Optional help information for media change."
 }
        When an internal error occurs, a JSON response containing the corresponding message will be returned: 
         {
      "status": "1",
      "message": "Error message."
 }
        Parameters:
        envId - The environment's ID to use for session.
        objectId - The object's ID to use for session.
        Returns:
        A JSON object describing the created session, else an error message.

      • startEnvWithSoftwarePackage

        public javax.ws.rs.core.Response startEnvWithSoftwarePackage(java.lang.String envId,
                                                             java.lang.String softwareId)
        Creates and configures a new session using specified environment and software package. When the session is successfully created, a JSON response will be returned, containing: 
         {
      "status": "0",
      "id": <Session's ID>,
      "driveId": <Drive's ID containing the digital object>,
      "iframeurl": <IFrame's URL>,
      "helpmsg": "Optional help message for media change."
 }
        When an internal error occurs, a JSON response containing the corresponding message will be returned: 
         {
      "status": "1",
      "message": "Error message."
 }
        Parameters:
        envId - The environment's ID to use for session.
        softwareId - The software package's ID to use for session.
        Returns:
        A JSON object describing the created session, else an error message.

      • stop

        public javax.ws.rs.core.Response stop(java.lang.String sessionId)
        Stops the specified emulation session.
        Parameters:
        sessionId - The ID of the session to stop.
        Returns:
        A JSON response containing the result message.

      • updateDescription

        public javax.ws.rs.core.Response updateDescription(de.bwl.bwfla.emil.datatypes.EnvironmentUpdateDescription desc)
        Updates the description of a specified Emil environment. This method expects a JSON object containing the description changes: 
         {
      "envId": <Environment's ID>,
      "title": "New title",
      "description": "New description"
 }
        When an internal error occurs, a JSON response containing the corresponding message will be returned: 
         {
      "status": "1",
      "message": "Error message."
 }
        Parameters:
        desc - A JSON object containing description changes.
        Returns:
        A JSON object containing the result message.
